title: Organic No Till Farming For Home Gardeners and Commercial Farmers

tasks.task: Planting and maintaining crops using a no-till farming method
subtasks: Establishing a cover crop by planting multiple seed types
Allowing the cover crop to grow vigorously
Using a roller to crush down the cover crop and terminate its growth
Laying durable woven plastic fabrics over the ground to exclude light
Securing the plastic edges with water-filled hoses or sandbags
Allowing the plastic to remain in place for one week to kill weeds and cover crop
Releasing the plastic and planting transplants in the prepared soil
Irrigating the planting area to hasten cover crop decomposition and nutrient release
Monitoring and addressing any remaining weeds through mechanical means or natural suppression
Timing planting to coincide with weather conditions for optimal growth and weed suppression

tasks.task: Managing soil nematodes using a cover crop and plastic exclusion method
subtasks: Planting a cover crop that is susceptible to nematodes
Allowing the cover crop to grow and attract nematodes
Covering the cover crop with the durable plastic fabric once nematodes are active
Allowing the covered crop to wither and die under the plastic to kill nematodes
Removing the plastic and planting a new crop that is resistant to nematodes

tasks.task: Uncovering and preparing a previously covered area for new planting
subtasks: Weighing down the durable plastic edges with water-filled hoses or sandbags
Allowing the covered area to remain under plastic for the specified time (e.g., one week)
Removing the plastic and preparing the soil for planting
Planting transplants directly into the soil without tillage
Ensuring proper irrigation and fertilization for new crop growth
Monitoring crop development and adjusting management practices as needed

tasks.task: 1. MAINTASK: Planting and maintaining crops using a no-till farming method and its subtasks (covering steps 1-7).
Managing soil nematodes using a cover crop and plastic exclusion method and its subtasks (steps 8-10).
Uncovering and preparing a previously covered area for new planting and its subtasks (steps 11-13).
